trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Media Services Accounts with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Media Services Accounts with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage Azure Media Services accounts with PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage Azure Media Services accounts with PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Media Services Accounts with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Media Services Accounts with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This articles shows you how to use PowerShell cmdlets to manage Azure Media Services accounts.
trans-unit.target: This articles shows you how to use PowerShell cmdlets to manage Azure Media Services accounts.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Install Microsoft Azure PowerShell Cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Install Microsoft Azure PowerShell Cmdlets

trans-unit.source: To install the latest Azure PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To install the latest Azure PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Select Azure Subscription
trans-unit.target: Select Azure Subscription

trans-unit.source: Once you install and configure PowerShell cmdlets, you should specify in which subscription you want to work.
trans-unit.target: Once you install and configure PowerShell cmdlets, you should specify in which subscription you want to work.

trans-unit.source: To get a list of available subscriptions run the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: To get a list of available subscriptions run the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Then, select one by doing:
trans-unit.target: Then, select one by doing:

trans-unit.source: Get Storage Account Name
trans-unit.target: Get Storage Account Name

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services uses Azure Storage to store media content.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services uses Azure Storage to store media content.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Media Services account, you have to associate it with a Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Media Services account, you have to associate it with a Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Storage account must belong to the same subscription as the one you plan to use for your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Storage account must belong to the same subscription as the one you plan to use for your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: In this example, an existing storage account is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example, an existing storage account is used.

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Get-AzureStorageAccount</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet gets storage accounts in the current subscription.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Get-AzureStorageAccount</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet gets storage accounts in the current subscription.

trans-unit.source: Get the name (StorageAccountName) of the storage account you want to associate your Media Account with.
trans-unit.target: Get the name (StorageAccountName) of the storage account you want to associate your Media Account with.

trans-unit.source: Create New Media Services Account
trans-unit.target: Create New Media Services Account

trans-unit.source: To create a new Azure Media Services account use the <link><linkText>New-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet providing Media Services account name, data center location where it will be created, and Storage account name.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Azure Media Services account use the <link><linkText>New-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet providing Media Services account name, data center location where it will be created, and Storage account name.

trans-unit.source: Get Media Services Accounts
trans-unit.target: Get Media Services Accounts

trans-unit.source: Once you created one or more Media Services accounts you can list information by using <link><linkText>Get-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Once you created one or more Media Services accounts you can list information by using <link><linkText>Get-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: By providing Name parameter you will get more detailed information including account keys.
trans-unit.target: By providing Name parameter you will get more detailed information including account keys.

trans-unit.source: Re-generate Media Services Access Keys
trans-unit.target: Re-generate Media Services Access Keys

trans-unit.source: If you want to update Media Services primary or secondary access key, use <link><linkText>New-AzureMediaServicesKey</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to update Media Services primary or secondary access key, use <link><linkText>New-AzureMediaServicesKey</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You need to provide account name and specify which key you want to re-generate (primary or secondary).
trans-unit.target: You need to provide account name and specify which key you want to re-generate (primary or secondary).

trans-unit.source: Specify a -Force switch if you do not want for the PowerShell to ask confirmation questions.
trans-unit.target: Specify a -Force switch if you do not want for the PowerShell to ask confirmation questions.

trans-unit.source: Remove Media Services Account
trans-unit.target: Remove Media Services Account

trans-unit.source: When you are ready to delete the Azure Media account, use <link><linkText>Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready to delete the Azure Media account, use <link><linkText>Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount</linkText><title></title></link>.
